review.reviewBody: I've worn these tights several times over my bike shorts.  On each occasion, they slipped down over my hips, and bunched up mid thigh.  This requires several stops to pull them back up again.  These tights badly need a draw string waist to keep them in place.
review.name: Tights slip over waist

review.reviewBody: These tights run very small.  I bought a pair of Amfib tights several years ago.  They fit great and have held up very well.  So Pearl iZumi's Attack tights were at the top of my list when I was shopping for lighter tights for spring and fall.  I bought the same size as my Amfib tights and that was the correct size according to the Attack tight's fit guide.  I should have sized up one or two sizes.  The Attack tights were super tight at the top of my calves behind my knees.  The waist band wrote down in the back as if it wasn't just too small, but also not cut high enough.
review.name: They run small

name: Attack Tight - Men's

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aura AG 65L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aura AG 65L Backpack - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aura AG 65L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aura AG 65L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aura AG 65L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was gifted the older model of this backpack a couple years ago as a new backpacker and it has since seen some real fun! The size is great for someone who tends to over pack and it worried about "not having the right thing". I really love the antigravity back panel, I don't feel the pack move as much while walking like you would for a typical commuter backpack. I'm still finding pockets and loops to put my stuff in. Just little features a new backpacker wouldn't know about. My only complaint about the one I have is the raincover wasn't included so I had to purchase one. 

I'm excited to purchase a smaller size, maybe 55L, and add the new PhotoLid to it!!
review.name: Big fan!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this backpack! I am just 5'0" and weigh about 105lbs and the XS fits well. Even on my small frame, I carry the 65L with no issues. The weight is distributed nicely and I am able to hike long distances. As a solo hiker, it's important that I can comfortably carry everything I need and this fits the bill. I love the many adjustable options for straps, waist straps, etc .. that have been added. Helps me feel like the pack was made custom for me. All of the pockets are so great too for easy access when on trail. Thank you, Osprey!
review.name: Love this backpack! I am

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, I am pretty disappointed with this new design. I retired my Aura AG 65 after 8 years and the XS/S waist digs into my rib cage and the M/L is way too big (shoulder straps and waist) even with the torso adjustment. I was excited for the upgrade especially since it included the rain cover. Sadly, I really miss the old packs that were sized differently. And I miss having the ability to stuff the extra straps into the waist belt. A huge miss in my opinion. I will have to go with a different brand or try to find the older models of this pack.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
I rarely write reviews but wanted everyone to know how cozy this pack is. I'm petite at 5'1" and have struggled with finding packs that fit me. This is most comfortable pack I have used in 20+ plus years of backpacking. 
I have loaded this pack up with backpacking gear including my ski gear for trips. It does amazing with a large load.
I went on a week long backpacking trip with three other ladies. 3 out of 4 of us used this pack. We were all different shapes and sizes but all of us loved the fit of the Aura.
review.name: Awesome Pack

review.reviewBody: Tag on back has msrp of $300, backcountry is charging more than that, a bit upset about that. Reviews of the pack show an internal flap that can be buckled down, if top section is removed, the pack no longer comes with this flap, if you remove the top part it is just the draw cord that seals the top, can’t say I love that. Otherwise seems pretty good.
review.name: backcountry price, missing flap

name: Aura AG 65L Backpack - Women's
Aura AG 65L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Became my favorite glove. I really like there is no velcro closure. It fits..."like a glove". Snug fit, minimal padding, good grip. I'm gonna get a second pair.

review.reviewBody: I've ridden these for apprx 1,000 miles. Superb glove: Light weight, minimal padding, texture areas in exactly the right place. I"m 6'0" and have a size large. Fits perfect. Planning to buy another pair as back up.

review.reviewBody: The panel is made with sturdy material, heavy not to be blown by the wind. I own 3 panels now I plan to buy 6 400 watt panels for my F3800
review.name: SOLIX 200W Foldable Solar Panel—great product

review.reviewBody: I am using my 200W SOLIX solar panel to charge up my SOLIX F3800. It is easy to set-up and is working great.
review.name: Great Solar Panel

review.reviewBody: These panels are well made and easy to deploy. They produce good output in full sun. They are easy to connect and manage with a battery unit such as the F2000. They are a bit heavy and honestly a bit pricey.
review.name: Anker Solix 200w foldable panel

review.reviewBody: I'm extremely impressed with the quality of the product. It's heavy duty, and should have little to no problem with wind. This is a ten out of ten. Anker outdid itself.
review.name: Solid, well made, and heavy duty

review.reviewBody: I have not tested the solar panel but it would be nice if you can provide more discount price on this panel. This is my second panel and I planning to get additional panel to make charging faster on my 767. Can you recommend another solar panel that will work on the 767? the 531 is a bit expensive that is why I'm asking for a discount.
review.name: Anker 531

review.reviewBody: I like that the cable included with the panel does not require any additional adapters. I also like the three options of the support legs to angle the panel depending on sun.
review.name: Easy to setup

review.reviewBody:
These Solar Panels work as described and are of excellent quality. I expect them to last a lifetime. They charge sufficiently and are easily managed and storable.
Thank you
review.name: great Quality and Craftsmanship

review.reviewBody:
I went all in on the Anker 767 Powerhouse including the extra battery and the solar panels.

For a complete solar novice like me the plug and play nature of the panels with the 767 is fantastic! 

I have been using the panels to recharge off grid as there is no other power source and I don't want to use or add a gasoline generator.
review.name: Using the Sun instead of Nasty Gasoline Generator to recharge my Powerhouse 767

review.reviewBody: Solar panels came in promptly as promised, quality very good, will likely buy several more
review.name: Portable solar panels

review.reviewBody: Just purchased a new unit along with an extra battery and solar panel. Haven’t had a chance to use it yet because of the weather but it is well built and arrived as advertised.
review.name: Anker 767

name: 531 Solar Panel 200W

review.reviewBody: Does what it’s intended to do. The protector stays in place when not in use. Hooks to the fidlock grip used on venom ice axe.
review.name: Does what it’s intended to

review.reviewBody: Don’t need this in the climb but it sure is the right thing to have for travel. No more holes!
review.name: Duffel Bag Saver

review.reviewBody: Does exactly what it is meant to do, and stays on the spike well when my ice axe is stowed for travel or storage.
It protects my gear from my ice axe. Not much else can be said
review.name: It protects my gear from

review.reviewBody: Great for storage and transportation to protect your backpack, clothing, car seats, etc. whenever not in use.
Definitely saved my sternum leaned into grab something from my pack and pushed the axe between me and the floor, spike up.
review.name: Holds on better than expected

review.reviewBody: The caps fit well and and easy to use. I did a double hitch on handle to keep cover on when not in use and it seems to stay
review.name: Well built

review.reviewBody: The petzl cover is more malleable and fits better on multiple spikes, but it falls off and gets lost. The bd one may be more clunky but it is more secure.
review.name: Better than petzl

review.reviewBody: Works perfectly. Stays in place while you’re climbing or traveling so the rest of your gear doesn’t get shredded.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: No more worrying about poking my eyes out working around small spaces with my ice tools/axes attached to my bag. Simple and easy to use.
review.name: No more snags!

review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket! Fits true to size and provides great protection against the elements. Keepa me dry from rain amd spray.

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I picked up my first pair of these over 2 years ago, and have worn them almost every day since. They have countless miles on them, have gone to 20,000ft humping 100lbs loads, stay on my feet for any climbing that’s under 5.8, and have been an absolutely fantastic shoe. The soles are like glue and inspire probably too much confidence on high exposure ridges. They have held up way better than they were expected to. The toe box is a bit narrow, which I expected would cause issues because I tend to prefer a wider toe box, but I just lace them loose when doing a lot of walking, but it is nice because you can lace them tight and get a fairly decent climbing performance out of them.
After 2 years of constant and not easy use, they are showing wear, I have worn through the heel fabric, the insoles have been worn through, the footbed is cracked, and I have a hole in the toe cap from crack climbing in them. They’re still wearable, and have gone back into daily use because the second pair I bought to replace the first didn’t fair very well. 

The issue I have with this shoe comes from the second pair I bought. REI had a pair on clearance and I picked them up to replace the first pair, I put them on for a 2 1/2 month Patagonia trip and at the end of the trip they were in worse shape than the original pair with considerably less abuse. The leather had split, the heel fabric had worn through, the soles were chunking, and the sole of the shoe was separating. I don’t know where La Sportiva changed production two between when the first pair and second pair were made, but it’s a huge difference in quality. 

So I guess buyer beware? I would like to think that the shoes you get will be the quality of the first pair I had, and if that’s the case, absolutely buy this shoe. It’s amazing and you won’t regret it. But I guess be prepared to be super disappointed when your new shoes fall apart after 2 mo of wear. If anyone has feedback on if this new color combo holds up I’d like to hear it, if they do I’m going to get another pair.
review.name: 1st pair fantastic, 2nd pair disaster.

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been searching for the best approach shoe for years, and these are the best I have tried to date. My former favorite was the Scarpa Crux II, but I have never been fond of the midsole, toe box, or edging abilities. TX Guides address all of these issues, but if you have wide feet, and like La Sportiva, look at the TX3 or 4, because TX Guides fit like Chuck Taylors. I encourage prospective buyers to size up by at least 0.5, because they run small.
review.name: A New Favorite

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm a 44.5. The TX3 fits perfect and has a much wider toe box. Even though I have narrow feet I need to move up to a 45 in this shoe. Love the TX3, Can't wait to get the proper size in the TX Guide.
review.name: Great Shoe, narrow toe box, runs small

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have used LA sportiva shoes for a long time. I had a pair of their purple and yellow climbing shoes in the 80s. A buddy of mine has a pair that are still useable.  Anyway,  My kids bought me a pair of the TX guide leather shoes for Christmas last year. I knew from the reviews and experience they run small so I wore them to work, on carpet, for a couple months they were painful at 1st but then widened and became snug.  I tried them in Aug. going up Mts Williamson & Tyndall via Shepherds pass.  They were fine in & up, but brutal hiking down.  3 toenails blackened   I stubbornly used the again in Sept. for a scramble up My Darwin via Lamarck Col.  They were fine in & out.  Then again in Oct. up Mt Ritter via Shadow creek trail. Again, fine.  However I later noticed that the tread was de-laminating from the sole & the sole was separating at the heel.   I estimate I used them about 80 -90 miles in the backcountry.  For the cost, I'd think you get many more miles before they start to disintegrate.  I will think twice before I buy La Sportiva again.
review.name: Dissapointed!!

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was excited to get these because I loved my TX2s but the fit is just really strange. I’m surprised others have said they run small but in my case they are significantly longer than my leather TX2’s (though the toe box area is certainly strangely narrow).  I have a wide fit and the TX2s fit my feet perfectly.  I don’t even want to try a smaller size in these guides because I know my toes will be crammed. Here are photos of comparison between the TX2 Leathers and TX Guide Leathers. Shockingly, both are 41.5. Maybe the TX2s just run small but I’m just really surprised there’s such a drastic difference. If you have really narrow feet though, I’m sure these would be great if you can size them correctly.
review.name: Simultaneously too narrow and too long

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: First, this is a well made show on inspection.  The issue I have with it is fit/sizing.  In short, the whole TX line is made with a narrow heel.  I did not know that until I bought the Guide.  I knew it had a narrower forefoot profile, but I am familiar with La Sportiva's style in that regard and have been able to deal with it by loosening the lacing in the toebox and ordering a half-size up (47.5 vs 47) in the Cirque Pro (really old) and the Boulder X.  Of course, the rest of the TX line has a wide forefoot, which I liked, but on long approaches I developed blisters around the cup of my heel.  Never happened before and I have owned shoes from virtually every maker.  Anyway, it never occurred to me that the heel fit/sizing was a problem until I tried the TX Guide.  After comparing them and the TX4 to other shoes it was obvious.  They are just narrower in the heel.  So, I had to return them.  Of course, if you have a narrower heel or you have tried any of the other TX line and did not have a problem ignore this as it promised to be a good, sturdy, but light, high performing shoe.  Of particular note, it is significantly stiffer than the TX4.  Two things about that.  It is easier on one's legs in long approaches and it protects the ball of one's foot on gnarly decents.  Both are important and a problem for the others in the TX line.
review.name: Good Quality but be careful of sizing

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the look of this shoe.  Rigid but pliable.  Very stable.  The shoes do take a while break-in.  I am using these for mid-level hiking, not hardcore climbing.
review.name: Great looking shoe, long break-in

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The TX Guide Leather Approach is s a very high quality and great looking shoe. Five stars for that. However, sizing, not so much! I had hoped to use them for an upcoming hiking trip to the mountains in North Georgia but unfortunately for me the sizing for this shoe is VERY different than most L.S. trail running shoes. I wear a 46.5 (12.5+) in L.S. Wildcats and Akyras but the TX in 46.5 felt VERY narrow and seemed to one to two sizes smaller (shorter)!
review.name: Sizing runs VERY small!!!!!
comment: I generally size up 0.5 sizes from TX4/TX2 sizing, and that seems to work about right. Def narrower than tx2/4 but the half size does accommodate a bit more as well.

review.itemreviewed: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
First off let me say the TX Guide/Guide leather climb very very well.  The lacing that extends to the end of the toe adds a lot of security that the other members of the TX family (2/3) didn?t provide. The rubber on the front section is noticeably gripper than the Vibram Megagrip seen on the other shoes and still decently durable. The defined heel and deep tread helps provide security on loose soil and terrain while the climbing section maintains impressive vertical performance. 

Now for the less interesting aspects. The TX Guide leather has a distinctly different fit than the TX Guide (synthetic) the toe box is noticeably roomier preventing the miserable break in period present on the synthetic version.  It doesn?t appear that this affects the climbing ability of the shoe though. 

The biggest issue of the TX guide was delamination of the sole so I hope to see with extended use that the glue Sportiva used on the sole on the guide leather is stronger
review.name: Important FYI
comment: How have the shoes held up?

name: TX Guide Leather Approach Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: No complaints about this product. Does what it needs to and is a compact size. The regulator valve seems to hold up well and provides the ability to slowly open air for more control. Good product.
review.name: Solid inflator

review.reviewBody:
Control Drive CO2 25G Purple/Hi Gloss: The Perfect Companion for Quick and Efficient Tire Inflation

When it comes to cycling, being prepared for unexpected situations is crucial. Flat tires can happen at any time, and that's where the Control Drive CO2 25G Purple/Hi Gloss comes into play. This compact and lightweight CO2 inflator is designed to provide cyclists with a quick and efficient solution for inflating their tires on the go. In this detailed review, we will delve into the features, benefits, and performance of the Control Drive CO2 25G, highlighting why it is a must-have accessory for all cyclists.

Swift and Hassle-Free Inflation:
The Control Drive CO2 25G Purple/Hi Gloss offers a hassle-free solution for tire inflation. With its 25-gram CO2 cartridge, this inflator allows for quick and effortless inflation, saving you precious time and energy when you're in a hurry. The control valve enables precise dosage, ensuring that you can inflate your tire to the desired pressure without overinflating. Its user-friendly design makes it easy for cyclists of all skill levels to use, providing convenience and peace of mind during emergency situations.

Compact and Lightweight Design:
One of the standout features of the Control Drive CO2 25G is its compact and lightweight design. This inflator is specifically engineered to be small enough to fit in your saddlebag or jersey pocket, ensuring that you can carry it with you wherever you go without adding unnecessary weight or bulk. Its sleek purple/hi gloss finish adds a touch of style, making it an attractive and functional accessory for any cyclist.

Durable Construction:
Durability is a crucial aspect to consider when it comes to CO2 inflators, and the Control Drive CO2 25G doesn't disappoint. Constructed with high-quality materials, this inflator is built to withstand the rigors of frequent use and various weather conditions. The robust construction ensures that it remains reliable and functional, providing peace of mind knowing that you have a dependable tool when you need it most.

Compatibility and Versatility:
The Control Drive CO2 25G is compatible with both Presta and Schrader valves, making it a versatile choice for cyclists with different types of tires. Whether you're riding a road bike, mountain bike, or hybrid, this inflator has got you covered. The inflator also features a secure threaded connection, ensuring a tight seal and preventing any leaks during the inflation process. Its compatibility and versatility make it a practical choice for cyclists who own multiple bikes or enjoy exploring different terrains.

Safety Features:
Safety is always a top priority, and the Control Drive CO2 25G incorporates several features to ensure a secure and controlled inflation experience. The inflator is equipped with an insulated sleeve that protects your hands from cold burns that can occur when the cartridge is activated. Additionally, the control valve allows you to regulate the flow of CO2, preventing sudden bursts and providing a controlled inflation process.

Ease of Use and Reusability:
Using the Control Drive CO2 25G is a straightforward process. Simply attach the inflator to the valve, open the control valve, and let the CO2 flow into the tire. The entire inflation process takes only a matter of seconds, allowing you to get back on the road swiftly. Moreover, this inflator is reusable, meaning you can replace the CO2 cartridge and use it multiple times, making it a cost-effective and environmentally friendly option.

Conclusion:
After thoroughly evaluating the features and performance of the Control Drive CO2 25G Purple/Hi Gloss, it is evident that this compact and reliable inflator is an indispensable accessory for cyclists. With its swift and hassle-free inflation, compact design, durability, compatibility, safety features, and ease
review.name: Perfect Companion for Tire Inflation

review.reviewBody: I really like Lezyne products. Nice design and well manufactured. This is another hit. So far it works as intended with no problems. I love the air control valve. No more worrying about over inflating. Can't ask for more when fixing a flat. Bought three, one for me, my wife, and for my brother. All are happy with them.
review.name: Great Inflation Control

name: Control Drive CO2

review.reviewBody: Highly rated helmet at reasonable price. Saved my head in a crash. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great helmet!

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet a couple of months ago because I needed an upgrade on mine. I went for the Specialized Align because of its MIPS technology. I find it comfortable and it is definitely more protective than my previous helmet.
review.name: Comfortable and protective helmet

review.reviewBody: I had to buy this helmet (in white) to replace the same model that I had for 2 years before leaving it on a train(!) It fits me well, adjusts easily, and the straps stay tight. I feel more secure because it has the MIPS technology, and the price can’t be beat. Just wish the neon green had been available, but very pleased that this helmet is still available.
review.name: Excellent Bike Helmet

review.reviewBody: Helmet is as pictured. It's adjustable so it fits just right, and the price was good.
review.name: Good fit and price

review.reviewBody: Purchased the XL. Perfect size for a large head. Comfortable and easy to adjust
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: I ordered the blue metallic one, and the color is nice and quality appearance is what's expected for a Specialized product. Helmet may work ok for some people who don't mind the thickness and weight of it. I put it on and looked huge,, my head was like portobello mushroom. Much thicker and heavier than the Giro Foray I'm looking to replace. Maybe is the combo sizing S/M and M/L (instead of having S, M and L sizing) as I use Medium size helmets.
review.name: Too Bulky

review.reviewBody: My wife and I both wear this helmet model. It is comfortable and the vents are pretty good for airflow. It ranks high in the IIHS/Virginia Tech ratings, especially for the price.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I did a lot of research prior to buying this helmet and was thrilled with the safety profile and price. Unfortunately, the straps that go around your ears are not adjustable. Only the chin strap can be adjusted. For me, the strap behind the ears was far too loose (I could fit my fist underneath it). If the helmet can't be adjusted to fit properly, the safety ratings are meaningless. I had to return it and buy one 3x as expensive but with adjustable straps.
review.name: Design flaw ruins the helmet
comment: You can adjust each strap individually to get a good fit around your ears.

name: Align II Mips Helmet

review.name: Wonderful snowsuit, boots, and mittens.

review.reviewBody: Everything is good here - quality, easy to get off and on, love the boot straps and the color. Total attention to detail and we adore it.

review.reviewBody: Wow do we love this snowsuit. My son loves it. It’s so comfortable (no scratchy material around the face). We have also gotten so many compliments with the little fur hood. I think it should fit him next winter too. It dries so quick. So easy to put on. No notes. 5/5.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Warm, waterproof and very stylish! We love ours!!
review.name: Great snowsuit!

review.reviewBody: Great suit. My grandson is 16 months and I took the 18-2 size . A little big now but not too big so it will be good for next year .
review.name: Snow suit warm and adorable on

review.reviewBody: Fantastic snowsuit! Cute color and love the fur hood! Kids remain totally dry!! And it’s easy for my kid to slide on and off with the oversized fit! Great for a busy mom, the toddlers can help me out.
review.name: Fantastic- warm and dry, cute kids!

review.reviewBody: Plush and warm definitely a bit large on the fit. Yet baby is growing fast. Love the look and trim!
review.name: High fashion

review.reviewBody: So happy with all Reima products I’ve purchased. High quality and made to last. Love that the snowsuits are larger for room to grow.
review.name: GREAT PRODUCTS

review.reviewBody: Both my kids are head to toe Reima this winter and I couldn't be more confident in taking them out in the cold to play. They don't feel the cold when they're wearing Reima! We love the look of this snowsuit, but even more, the functionality! My son can run and jump and sled and ride his bike and he doesn't feel constricted or like he's drowning in his gear. Reima gear is simply unmatched! I will always be purchasing for Reima as long as I'm having kids!
review.name: Unmatched Snowgear

review.reviewBody: I just received the 110L split bag and am a bit disappointed. I like the look of the bag and it seems well made. The organization is nice, as are the support flaps. The real issue is that it's smaller than advertised. The bag is 31 inches tall on the exterior, not 32. The inside is 30 inches so you cannot fit a standard 4-piece fishing rod (31") straight, you need to angle it. You can force it in straight but it will not drop into the bag, it just gets trapped above the plastic pan and floats. See images of the rod and measurement of the bag.
review.name: Smaller than advertised

review.reviewBody:
I'm so stoked with this bag. It feels super sturdy (including the wheels and handle), and the exterior handles are in the right places. The compartments are generous and I still think it's insane that it'll hold a helmet in the top section- while having the big compartment storage as well. Love the fact that it has a non-mesh side to the top for shoes or dirty laundry. The material feels durable and the extra clips give me a little more faith than usual in the zipper.

I travel quite a bit as a videographer and I couldn't be happier with the space it has. I've been using a military rolling bag for the past few years, but they don't have a telescoping handle. You'd be surprised how much of a difference that makes when you have to walk any distance with the bag fully loaded.  Plenty of room for a week's worth of clothes and extras.
review.name: An absolute tank.

review.reviewBody: Great bag, bought it to replace my old one that lasted 15 years, but it doesn’t look as resistant as the old one, I used it once and the side is already all wavy
review.name: It’s a great bag,

review.reviewBody: I bought this, anticipating a trip where I would need a number of accessories. The suitcase was perfect. Easy to handle. Terrific design of compartments. Sturdy. I could not be happier.
review.name: Dakine split roller

review.reviewBody: I no longer worry about my gear getting damaged during unexpected rain or rough weather conditions. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Highly functional

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of these shorts in a Medium approximately 2 years ago -- quickly became one my favorite items to wear for a ride or just out and about. Ordered two more pairs, again in Medium, during a recent sale -- but the new shorts are absolutely too small. The original Medium fits perfectly, while the newer version fits like an entire size down. I've returned the Medium and may try the Large instead. Other than the sizing change, still a great piece of clothing.
review.name: Sizing has changed -- too small!

review.reviewBody: So I know Castelli runs small, but these short were ridiculously small.  I may be getting older and rounder but I wear a medium in all shorts and I couldn't even fit into a large.  I have a 32" waist if that helps anybody else in terms of sizing.
review.name: So Small
comment: same here.  i took it out of the package and didnt even bother putting them on.  i too wear 32" shorts.  would need an XL if i decided to get these again. lol

review.reviewBody: I usually wear the La Sportiva Solution Comp (red ones) which I live but they feel tight. I switch to those and the difference in comfort is simply amazing. The scarpas feel like a sock, so comfy and soft! You can feel everything. I recommend!
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
First off, I wear a 42.5 in most Sportivas, and I found the same size in the Drago LV to be a little smaller/tighter than similar sized shoes right out of the box. However, this is a very soft, split sole shoe with very soft XS Grip 2 rubber - so I assure you, they WILL stretch. Initial sizing is on the small side, but wear them for a few sessions and they'll quickly stretch a half size or more. If you're afraid of the initial fit, I'd recommend sizing up one half of a European size.

Like the regular Drago, they have rubber in all of the right places, but a little less material on the upper, a narrower heel, and a slightly narrower toe box. So if you found yourself swimming in the regular Dragos like I did, give these a shot. Toe and heel hooks just feel so much more locked in when you have a snug fitting shoe that's this sticky.

Aesthetically speaking, they're an attractive shoe since they're not colored with some retina-frying fluorescent colors that clash with every other piece of gear. I don't care much about the look of the shoe myself, but if you're the type that does, it may be worth mentioning that I get many compliments on these shoes.

I especially appreciated the construction of the upper. Unlike every pair of Evolvs I've tried (and several other manufacturers shoes), there was no annoying seam above my big toe, digging into my knuckle and stripping me of my will to climb.

I would definitely recommend these for steep and/or overhung routes/boulders. I would not recommend them for slabby climbs where you need to stand or pivot on many tiny edges - remember, these are very soft shoes.
review.name: Possibly my new favorite shoe?

review.reviewBody:
This is the fifth climbing shoe I've tried and by far my favorite. They do run small. I wear a 7.5M women's shoe and bought these in 39.5 and they still felt super tight and took a while for me to break them in to my comfort level. 
Great aggressive shoe though - better than my Booster S and Futuras.  Considering buying a backup pair as mine are now out for resole.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody: I'm sure they would've been great if the sizing wasn't so severely screwed up!  A Backcountry rep swore to me that I will be fine with the same size as my street shoes, which is 37-38 depending on the manufacturer.  So I bought size 38, and they're TINY!!!  To make matters worse, I live in Argentina, so returning these shoes and buying new ones is not a small feat!  You have to wait for someone to be flying in to bring stuff to you, so you end up waiting for weeks or months.  Which is what I now have to do.  Word of the wise: when buying Scarpa, size UP at least 1 size from your street shoes, otherwise you won't fit into them!  So upset right now, can't even begin to come to terms with this.
review.name: Too SMALL

review.reviewBody: This is my 5th pair of Oboz and sadly the first pair I didn’t like. The waterproof lining doesn’t lay flat in the toe box so it pooches away from the top of the shoe, hitting the top of my toes. It was on both shoes so it wasn’t a fluke. I immediately could tell this would rub a blister pretty fast. The shoe is VERY stiff too. So with both of those issues, I packed them up and returned them the same day they were delivered. I’ll stick with my sawtooths and bridgers.
review.name: Waterproof lining is loose - returned

name: Katabatic Low B-DRY Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite backpacking luxury item. It weighs next to nothing and I can stuff it with my down coat and whatever else I want to depending on the firmness I want. I love this so much I took one to the hiking gift exchange last year (big hit!) and ordered two this year for gifts. I can’t think of ANYONE that sleeps outside that wouldn’t LOVE this! Now... if you could just do it in a hot pink or something, all of us girlies would be so happy and it’d be so easy to find in the bottom of my pack!
review.name: Backpacking LUXURY!

review.reviewBody: We’ve been using these to help store/pack a set of sheets on the way up to our cabin and it works great. One of these pillowcases, perfectly fits a set of twin sheets and gives the kids a pillow for the car ride up.

review.reviewBody: I needed some extra pockets for my weekly 6-mile dog walks.  This waist pack is exactly what I needed for storing my keys, wallet, dog treats, and a few other accessories.  It's very nice to free up the pockets in my shorts/pants to add comfort to my walks.

review.reviewBody: As other reviewers have said, this is a nice waist pack, just on the small side.  I need it for walking large dogs, & can fit in my phone, keys & a couple of bags, but that's about it.  So it's adequate, but too small even for a headset in a case.  I find the waist strap also tends to loosen some, but that may be just me, because a friend who has one doesn't have a problem.

review.reviewBody: On the small side, but perfect for the essentials. Strap and clasp are well made and the compartment has a nice thick pad on it so it rides smooth no matter what is in it. And a sweet design!

description: Buy the Wild Country Helium Quickdraw - 6-Pack online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Helium Quickdraw - 6-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wild Country Helium Quickdraw - 6-Pack online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love these draws!
review.name: Love these draws!

review.reviewBody: Great no snag carabiners for draws. I repurposed these for alpine draws and they work great for trad climbing.

I've used these draws extensively since they came out a few years ago on hundreds of pitches. These are some of the lightest, easiest to clip and bomber draws for casual sport and pushing grades. The gates are wide and forgiving while at the same time being easy to clean -- even on very overhung routes. Bottom line is that these things are ultra premium. The main criticism this draw often gets is that it doesn't have a huge (and thus heavy) dogbone handle for you to grab, but if you want to aid climb go grab some djinn axes. Instead, take the whip, reset and give it another go. The truth is, you'll pay almost double replacing whatever draws you have with these later on. I have a full sport rack of these and then some loose helium biners for trad. No other quickdraw has come close to beating this original helium biner design. Note that the helium 3.0 biner is slightly heavier than this version and other versions of this draw offer longer slings. I suggest picking up some lose helium biners for adjustable lengths (if you can find them). Genuine product user and not paid for this review - that's how much I love these draws.
review.name: Ultra premium. Period.

name: Helium Quickdraw - 6-Pack

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Archeon 24L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Archeon 24L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Archeon 24L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This bag is rad! This bag also fit snugly against my back, and more comfortably, than a handful of other similar bags that I tried. I give it 5+ stars for comfort and fit. I give it 5+ stars for cool-factor. I bought the "scenic valley"/green, and it is a super cool color, nice change up from standard black without being all bright. This reminds me of a lot of commuter-style packs, fairly rectangular in shape, plenty of options to strap their other accessories. 

I really love the clever side water-bottle pockets, which are a little hard to see in product photos but each side is a mesh pocket with basically 360 degree coverage, to keep your water bottle or other belongings from falling out when the pack tips over or if you're running/hiking/cycling in a bumpy environment. You have to kind of tuck the water bottle in the center of the side pockets like a pouch with the opening toward your back. The only downside of this design being it makes a quick grab of water bottle a little more fussy so may have to take pack off to grab your drink (i usually do anyway), but I think that's a worthy trade-off for having it secure your waterbottle/belongings much better than a typical top-entry pouch. 

The two horizontal straps across the back are removable or can be used to attach other accessory packs, maybe strong enough to hold a skateboard but probably not a snowboard(?). You can also remove the strap that goes across the waist (I rarely use a waist straps), but the way the shoulder straps connect you still have the side-panels of the waist strap in place. Still a very comfortable deluxe rugged pack.

This would actually be a great bike/motorcycle pack if I didn't already have one, as it's weather resistant, stylish, rugged, and fits great tight against the back where a lot of packs kind of lean out off your back this one stays snug in place. Zippers are extremely heavy-duty, borderline a little tough-to-open but seems the focus is on being weather safe so that's also worth the trade off. I also like that on top of the shoulders there are two little straps attaching to top/back of the pack to further help pull the top of the pack back in closer to your shoulders. Has one big duffel-style open which is actually a little impractical with the two horizontal back straps in place as you have to maneuver the zipper under them, but I'd rather have that option than a lot of packs that are top-open-only. The laptop zipper on top can be used for quick-access just to the laptop, but that zipper also accesses the main compartment, the laptop zipper is just a quick way to get just the laptop out, very ideal for travel.

The only thing I think the pack could use is perhaps an extra pocket on the back to quickly slide wallet/keys/belt when travelling through TSA, in addition to the one top pocket. That would easily be solved with one of the Osprey accessory packs that can attach, but seems even another slim pocket would've been useful in addition, but more pockets = more zippers = more cost and this one already a little on the pricier side. 

 I bought the 24L in the I bought this pack to use primarily for travel as a bag that could fit a laptop, fit under airline seat, function as a second carry-on pack to combo with an airline roll-aboard/carry-on. It fits all of those criteria perfectly. I also, however also wanted a pack I could use for work-travel to carry my laptop in to customer meetings, and it just felt a little too rugged for my needs. After long-hard contemplation over a few days, I think I am returning this bag only because in my opinion it's just a little too rugged for my typical office/meeting use. I think it's much more travel/commuter pack that can get you to the office, but just a little less professional-office-guy looking for me.

For an awesome airline travel pack, or moto / cyclist commuter pack, this this is phenomenal.
review.name: Cool, rugged, comfortable perfect fit

name: Archeon 24L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Standard wind jacket in terms of weight and material. I've never used in the wet, but it blocks the wind well without trapping heat in. I like the hand pockets and appreciate that they have light weight zippers. The real stand out feature is the fit, it strikes a great balance between XC and trail riding. Just loose enough to accommodate a couple layers but cut fairly slim with no excess material, good for all but the fastest of XC rides. Bonus points for no useless hood (I wouldn't have bought it if it had had one) and it packs down well.
review.name: nice wind jacket for xc/trail

name: Ranger Wind Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Buxton Pull On WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these with the idea of being able to slip them on quickly without much effort of having to lace up a pair of boots every time I go outside. I cant even get these on. They are more difficult than putting on a pair of ski boots. Total fail.

review.itemreviewed: Buxton Pull On WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm not a big fan of any type of shoe above my ankles but these are some of the most comfortable boots I've bought for work being I work outdoors in the Colorado snow nightly these keep my feet very warm. My only complaints which isn't the boots fault but walking around all night I start to get to much friction around my ankles and up the lower shin wear it burns almost by pulling my leg hairs haha anyway out side of that I wish these were oil slip resistant other wise these are about perfect.
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Agility Peak 5 BOA GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
cushiony, and supportive. Feel like they are walking me. A better walking shoe than my Nike pegasis.
I wish the front toe area was more spacious. I could play 9 holes of golf but not finish 18 because the front was feeling cramped. Wish I had gotten another half size or more.
review.name: They walk me
comment: It's incredibly rewarding to know that our efforts are making a difference.

review.itemreviewed: Agility Peak 5 BOA GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love the idea of this shoe. Its super easy to get on and off and the boa makes it quick to tighten. However, the reason for my 3 star review is because I experience a lot of heel slip and in order to fix the heel slip I have to tighten the boa to the point that my instep is too tight and I loose circulation to my toes meanwhile still experiencing some heel slip.

Would recommend this shoe, just not the boa version. It either needs a second boa lacing to tighten the lower portion and another for the upper portion or just stick to the laces. A single boa just doesn't allow for the "customization" in tightness or lack thereof a proper trail shoe requires.

I now use them as a overqualified "around town" shoe and don't worry about t he heel slip as much.
review.name: Sweet Shoe but...
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody:
Just like the first Thule bars I owned many years ago, these SquareBar Evo bars accommodate the original load stops. After several iterations of aerodynamic Thule and non-Thule bars, I realize now prefer the square bar system for ladders, lumber, canoes, etc.
The Evo system foot is an improvement over the original.
Wind noise (on a 2023 Kia Telluride) is managed by keeping front bar as far rearward as practical, and using a spiral of bungee cord on both bars.
review.name: An improved square bar system

review.reviewBody: Bought a new set of towers and SquareBar EVO for a new car. Installation was easy and quick. I love the torque wrench tool to deliver precise torque to the hold down bolts. I have old bike racks from an older EVO bar and they fit perfectly. One of the best engineered products I have ever purchased
review.name: Thule Rack System Install and Interoperability

review.reviewBody: I find it very disconcerting that in 2018 I purchased a fit kit and cross bars to my 2017 Jeep grand Cherokee and then discovered that I had to purchase a complete !new fit kit and crossbars for my 2023 Jeep Grand Cherokee. This is in my opinion LUDICROUS
review.name: Cross bars
comment:
Hello Ruby, 
Thank you for sharing your input and experience with the Thule SquareBar Evo. I understand your frustration with needing to update your roof rack system to the new vehicle. 
While in many cases Thule roof rack systems can be re-used between vehicles, changing car designs, attachment point styles, and vehicle size may require changing one or more parts of a roof rack system to ensure a compatible, safe, and secure fit. While this does mean some up-front expense, the new vehicle will benefit from a tailor-made adapter and fit, and any updates to product design and materials from an older model to a newer system, when required.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had most of the different bars and I still prefer the square bar, thanks Thule for continuing to make this product.
review.name: Great to have square bars still

review.reviewBody: I just opened the box and don't see any instructions. I just see two metal bars. I'm not sure if i have all the parts...Seems I will need to research how to assemble on line!
review.name: no instructions!

review.reviewBody: Quality product....quiet noisy traveling down the hwy.
review.name: Thule Square Bar

review.reviewBody: If the max load is 220 pounds, two adult plus the tent is easily over 300 lbs. Please explain? Thanks.
review.name: Then how do you put roof-top tent with two adult?
comment:
Thank you for your interest in Thule products!
The weight capacity of the Thule crossbar system refers to the "dynamic weight capacity" of the vehicle, or the amount it is able to carry while in motion. Thule crossbars are generally able to support about three times the dynamic weight capacity while the vehicle is at rest, though this is vehicle dependent. The exact weight capacity and rooftop tent compatibility is dependent on the vehicle itself and the attachment system needed to secure the Thule crossbars. 
For more information on rooftop tent fitment, please visit the information page on Thule.com:
https://www.thule.com/en-us/articles/guides/how-do-rooftop-tents-work-a-complete-guide#fit

review.reviewBody: Easy to assemble, perfect fit.  Square bar is noisy from wind, however it is the preferred choice to attach cargo with rope. Wing bar is not as good if you are tieing cargo down with rope.
review.name: Easy to assemble

review.reviewBody: I put this bar on my 2019 F150 supercrew and it is a real solid bar. However wind noise is horrible starting as low as 70km/hr and unbearable at 90km/hr. I move the bar back with no relief. Then I used an old pool noodle, cut length way and wrapped it around the front bar and the wind noise was eliminated for both front and back bars. The back bar didn't need a noodle.
review.name: Solid but noisy

review.reviewBody:
We are quite happy with the Thule SquareBar Evo 118 product.

Pros:
- Relatively easy to install
- Lightweight
- Look good.

Cons:
- Noisy on the highway as they are not aerodynamic.
review.name: Good basic roof rack option.

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: Good fit. I like the additional storage of this vest. I am able to put my extra short and shirt during runs when I have to catch the bus back home. One down fall is that I am unable to use my Salomon trek pole bag with this vest. But my trek poles can fit in the back storage. But that’s not my preference.
review.name: Great gear

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody:
I have run approximately 70 miles with the pack and I am very pleased. It is comfortable, easy to use, and can carry a lot of gear.
If I could change anything I would 1. Add connections for the quiver for carrying poles, 2. Move the side pocket access a little closer to the front of the body.
I am very happy with the product.
review.name: Excellent Carry All

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: I got this vest as a Birthday present after being recommended it by a friend. I had a previous Salomon vest which is now about 10 years old and has gotten me through many miles of running. The fit and quality of the vest is great so far, I hate anything moving around and this vest fits like a glove. I am loving the additional space at the back and the zip front pockets that are not made of mesh type of material they look a lot more hardwearing than my previous vest (which still lasted for a decade!). Look forward to using this for my first ultra marathon event in October. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great running vest love it!

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: Purchased for a 50 miler. Had to experiment a bit with the best way to secure poles, but once dialed in, worked great. As others mentioned, my back got warmer than with other packs but that’s expected with how weather resistant it is. Be careful with upper front pockets as stuff can slip out when bending over so the zipper pockets are the best option for slimmer items like a cell phone.
review.name: Roomy Pack

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: This vest absolutely disappears and you forget you’re wearing it sometimes. Long time UD guy (PB 1.0 Adventure, Jurek FKT, Mountain Vest 4.0, 5.0). I became very disappointed in the durability of their products. The ADV Skin feels soft and is highly breathable. Fits snug which reduces bouncing. The first thing I noticed was how streamlined it was. UD had too many straps, pockets, buckles, etc. This is incredibly dialed and easily the best vest currently in the market.
review.name: Magic Trick 🪄 🐇

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody:
At 11.29 oz, this vest already feels weightless. How did Salomon make a 15 liter pack with a built in dry bag system for this weight? With intelligent placement of blends consisting of 100% polyamide and 100% polyester in high abrasion areas and saving weight in other less abrasive areas. It takes about 3 meters worth of water pressure for your contents to begin to get wet. And yet, this pack does not feel hot on your back as you exert energy. 

Speaking of contents, there are several easy to access pockets to store all types of your favorite pieces of gear, which can be especially important if you are running ultras and through the night. This could hold a couple nights worth of supplies such as a bivy, food, a first aid kit, a shell jacket, extra clothing, fire starter, map, compass and a few more items if needed/ wanted (yes I am guilty of overpacking). 

There are several adjustments available to you as your body weight/ shape ebbs and flows. A left and right chest bungee, a left and right bottom rib bungee and of course being able to move around the chest pieces and the main adjustable bungee. 

The ugly (albeit almost unnoticeable): The only two pockets that can be potentially difficult to access are the two back stretch pockets as it helps to be quite flexible to reach those items without removing the vest. The zippered pockets on the front can become very tight to fit items in/ take them out when the two full 0.5 liter bottles are utilized. I keep my topo map strapped to the bungee on the outside for quick access…but if I want to put it back, I need to be taking the best off completely. This vest does not come with the soft 0.5 liter bottles.

Overall, I recommend this vest for advanced to expert runners (beginner runners save your money and start small like the ADV Skin 5 which I’ve used for 5 years and it is still kickin’ it on trail and road. The Cross Season 15 can be used on 100 mile runs and won’t limit you and will also be great on 3 mile mountain traverses.
review.name: Versatile and Lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: I purchased this to replace my 10 litre Inov8 pack. I’ve entered a 70 mile event in June and needed a bigger pack. I can just fit all my equipment in the pack and the outside pockets are useful for food etc. I don’t use soft flasks but the bladder instead but this makes the inside smaller. My first run with full kit went okay but he next week I tried it and ended up with friction burns on my back and shoulders. No idea how I’m going to cope on the day. Guessing I’ll have to use a lot of rock tape. If I had the money I would try a different pack but I don’t. 🙄
review.name: Good sized pack but uncomfortable
comment: Thank you for your opinion about Salomon product. We are really sorry to hear about your disappointment. This feedback will be reported to our product manager. Hopefully, we will be able to improve our product line or offer a product that will better suit your needs in the future.

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody:
Love this bag, a little heavy but it’s the only all weather option. I like my Raidlight ultralight a little more because it’s much lighter and waterproof but this bag offers many more pockets. The liner is thick which is a con but it holds a lot.

Please: HOW DO YOU ATTACH A QUIVER
review.name: How do you attach quiver

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: I bought this for an upcoming multi day race with a lot of mandatory kit, which I was struggling to fit in my usual pack (12l adv skin). I love the adv skin so took the plunge for the 20l even though it isn’t custom quiver compatible.  Took it out on a run in the hills, I struggled to access the side pockets, I had food fall out.  The side mesh pockets are not as easy to reach as other packs, you almost had to be able to dislocate your shoulders to get to them. I think because the pack is shorter (short even for me and I’m 5ft 3) and deeper, it’s quite uncomfortable. I also ended up feeling like due to the layout of the pack and the side pockets not being the best placed I was no better off than I was with the 12L. I reverted to an old montane pack.  Advantage was it held up against the weather,
review.name: No where near as good as the adv skin 12
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback and experience with us. We are very sorry to learn of your disappointment. Helpful reviews like this allow us to continue to improve for the future. Your feedback has been passed to our Production Manager. If you wish to discuss this any further, please feel free to contact us here;
https://www.salomon.com/en-gb/shop-emea/contact/

review.itemreviewed: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: Bought this for extra capacity over my other packs that I use for 100 mile races and the waterproofing feature. Used it for Northern Traverse 300km. The good: roll top entry is better than side zips for easy access. Pack fits well without bouncing. The bad; the bottle pockets are ridiculously tight. They have no stretch. Had to buy salomon speed flasks as they were slimmest style of bottle and even they were almost IMPOSSIBLE to get in the vest. The so called easy hook system on front chest straps really aren't easy with cold hands. Actual available storage space really isn't that great as there is no stretch in the material. Fine for shorter events up to 100 mile max (depending on kit needs) but definitely not a multi day friendly pack. That's on me I guess. Storage options up front not as good as I would have liked. With full bottles there's really no way to use the pocket in front and if you fill them then its even harder to get refilled bottles back in. I also had items work their way out of the front mesh pocket. I added an OMM compressor pod to the rear to get more usable storage for the race. Overall disappointed as the pack is comfortable to wear but little frustrations in long events wastes time and also become issues in combination with sleep deprivation!
review.name: OK but not great
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback and experience with us. We are very sorry to learn of your disappointment. Helpful reviews like this allow us to continue to improve for the future. Your feedback has been passed to our Production Manager. If you wish to discuss this any further, please feel free to contact us here;
https://www.salomon.com/en-gb/shop-emea/contact/

name: Adv Skin Cross Season 15L Hydration Vest

review.reviewBody:
Lightweight, reasonably comfortable considering the amount of padding, secure fitting.

The waistbelt is kind of a pain to set but once you do it, its not moving. The gear loops are good but could be better, clipper slots are well placed and perfect for ice encounters.

I love the ability to put on and take off while still wearing my crampons and was able to do so without much effort.

The belay loop seems small compared to other makes, but go check out the video on the blue ice site for info, they're putting technology into this thing to make it so light and small.
review.name: Great Ice/Alpine Harness

review.reviewBody: Primary reason I got this harness was for mountaineering, so I need the leg loops to be easily undone/redone. I struggled to do this with my two bare hands, and can’t imagine I’d be remotely successful with any kind of glove on.
review.name: Leg loops really difficult to undo

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I use these shoes for city walking and hiking. The shoes are very comfortable and great fitting.
The shoes are good for all types of terrain. I walk on sand, cement and rocks around Lake Michigan. I recommend these shoes and the regular Moab speed shoes for milder weather.
review.name: GREAT WALKING AND HIKING SHOES
comment: Thank you for sharing your 5 star review!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wear these boots every day at work. I walk about 12000 steps a day at work and these are hands down the best boots I've ever worn. They are comfortable right out of the box. Feel like a pair of running shoes instead of gore-tex boots.
review.name: Great Boots!!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Needed shoes for a trip to late-November Netherlands!  My old Merrel 'boots' are still with me but have ... transitioned to my 'outdoor work boots' now and so, these Speeds were bought on the quick with the hope.  And man did they deliver.  Brand new shoes, walking over 16,000 steps each day of a FABULOUS 6 day trip thru and around Amsterdam, in the cold and rain.  These shoes were like....what?  let's go!
Merrel had done it again, I have another favorite pair of shoes.  Comfy enough to wear 'all the time', functional enough to 'get the need done'.
review.name: To Amsterdam and back again...

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: out the box they fit very tight wish id gone up half a size from my normal size, hope they stretch a bit. also no arch support or very minimal, my legs/feet lean in a lot when walking.
review.name: fits a little small, not much arch support

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are great footwear for the outdoors. Well constructed no issues.
review.name: Status Check !

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic shoes for every day wear and for more adventurous outings. Breathe well, fit well, holding up with no problem getting twenty thousand steps a day. Getting a replacement insole helped as the one that comes with the shoe is unfortunately thing.
review.name: Great all day
comment: Thank you for your rating!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality boot, biggest downfall in my opinion is the laces, they dont stay tight and could have been a heavier weight lace.
review.name: Laces

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are great! I bought them as replacements and took them on a 3 day, 62 mile hiking weekend without break-in. They performed great as do all my Merrell boots and shoes with no rubbing or blisters. Keep up the good work Merrell!
review.name: Great right out of the box!
comment: Thanks for the awesome feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have tried multiple brands of hiking boots from Danner, Vasque, Hi-Tek, Bates, etc. The MOAB Speed 2 boots feel great on my feet. I ordered a half size larger than normal due to past experience with Merrell boots (10-10 1/2) and these boots fit great. The heel support is good and the cushion is great. I gave up a pair of Danner's for these. The Danners did not give me the cushion and support I need at my age. The Danners are durable, however I feel the Speed 2's will be also as they seem well constructed. I have only worn them around town and not on any extended hikes at this time. In this application they have been a joy to wear. I will report back after one year and give an update on durability. For now I would say buy with confidence if you are looking for something more than a sneaker but you don't want the hard sole of a more traditional (old school) hiking boot.
review.name: Great Boots!

name: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Coming from my Lange boot the Solomon S/Pro Alpha 120 was a big improvement. Minor adjustments like you make on any boot were made and that's all. I skied all season hard. I missed 10 days total for weather. At the end I did lose a cuff pivot screw. I found a temporary replacement. Solomon was quick in replacing the part. The service was outstanding with great communication.
review.name: Good boot and good service

review.reviewBody: I am so happy with these boots. They've been perfect from the moment they arrived. I've broken them in the past few runs and they're easily the most comfortable and responsive boot I've worn.

review.reviewBody: Wish it came with replacement toes pieces and I wish the top strap was more of a boster style with more grip

review.reviewBody: Amazing boots 🥾 Very comfortable from day one. I loved the style and colour
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I like these a lot.  They are comfortable, and are good for white collar work. They feel light for a boot. I took a 40 minute walk in a downpour and my feet stayed dry. The only complaint is that they appear too shiny, like vinyl.  I'm hoping they develop character like a work boot. The fit is a little big so I size down, the toe box is roomy.
review.name: Comfortable and practical

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband loves these. He wore them and told me how comfortable they are. The fit is very strong prefect for activity filled days. They are non slip and give great support.
review.name: One of my favorite brand for shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are VERY comfortable they go with everything. They are true to size. Very durable don’t feel cheap have a good grip as well and support you ankles for a long period of time! Would definitely recommend these
review.name: Very comfortable shoes for everything

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] my husband said the fit on these were a little snug, but he said he can see them being very comfy! unfortunately i got one size too small so i cannot say how the durability or breath ability is for these boots.
review.name: give it a try

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve never had a pair from Sorrel brand and I need to say I’m really impressed with the quality! All the stitches look neat, both interior and exterior. The leather feels soft yet durable and looks flawless. This model is true to size and my feet feel very comfortable in it. The only thing I don’t really like about this model is the flat outsole that looks a bit weird to my taste but it’s still comfy to wear. Overall these are great boots for warm California winter - not too hot, not too cold. I’m excited to wear them soon.
review.name: Comfortable and well made

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sorel Slabtown boot in my initial impressions is a very comfortable well made durable boot that will provide comfort, durability, and great support on a job site or working on outside on agricultural equipment. My only concerns are with how much waterproof are the boots and how easily the can be scratched on the outer leather. I would not recommend this for hunting.
review.name: Quality comfortable work boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The only reason I gave it a 3 star is because it came smelling the moth balls really badly. I had to leave them outside to let them air out. My dad took them and loves them.
review.name: Men’s boot
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so excited to get these boots from Sorel for my husband. We were initially very impressed by the quality and looks of the boot. As with all Sorel products, we are happy with how they hold up to daily activities. The leather is thick and stitching thorough. They also broke in easily, are waterproof, and hold up to heavy use. My husband took these off roading on his first wear and it’s now his favorite shoe for outdoors activities AND work. These are some of the most practical yet stylish men’s boots out there.
review.name: Sharp-looking boots that are perfect for outdoor activities!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very beautiful looking shoe. Love that they are waterproof. It’s over 100 degrees so my husband hasn’t been able to wear them in the rain yet, hopefully n the winter. The perfect boot for fall with jeans and a flannel. Can be dressed up or down. It was very easy to loosen them up for the initial putting on. The one thing that surprised me was that the foot bed was a bit narrow. If you wear wool socks with these or have a wide food, these may be uncomfortable. Try on before you buy if that’s the case.
review.name: Beautiful looking boot for fall
comment: Hello veerey, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our SLABTOWN 62'™ Men's Waterproof Moc Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

name: Slabtown 62 Moc WP Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
My favorite hiking/ activity pants.
I really have been wearing these pants on all my outdoor adventures this year. 
They have a slightly loose fit which accommodates my booty and thighs. They sit nicely on my hips so I don't have to worry about them sliding down when I crouch to look at flora. I can cinch the cuffs easily. They are cute ( I got the teal blue ones) and the best feature is the pockets. Beautifully deep that take my whole phone and with the already described waistband, the added weight does not pull the pants down or create bunching. 
Love them so much I already bought the black pair.
review.name: POCKETS!

review.reviewBody: I ordered these boots in 2021 and they are still in perfect condition 3 years later after constant wear. So warm and keeps my feet dry.
review.name: Long lasting comfort and warmth

review.reviewBody: These are soooo comfy and easy to get on and off because of the handles. I love the color (wine) and they're super cute. I get loads of compliments on them, but most importantly, unlike every other winter boots I've ever owned, they don't give me blisters!
review.name: The Only Winter Boots that Don't Give me Blisters!

review.reviewBody: I wore these this weather when I tell you my feet were soak they were..I wish i could get an refund.DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY THERE NOT WATERPROOF.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.reviewBody: Super happy with these boots. Super comfortable and stylish. I normally wear a 7.5/ 8 in shoes- first purchased an 8 (too big), and exchanged for a 7. They don't come in half sizes, so I was crossing my fingers that the 7's would work- to my happy surprise they fit perfectly. They are also super warm and have excellent traction.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable, excellent treads, robust ankle support & pull on handles make these my Number 1 go to boot for safely, fashionably navigating snow, in the city ,& country.
review.name: Best boots ever

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a boot that would support my foot, keep it warm in very cold weather, be comfortable enough to wear for a long time, was able to stand up to the wear and tear of farm chores, and yet look very stylish when worn for other activities. This boot checked all the boxes. Thank you for a very great product.!
review.name: Quality product!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! Easy on and off and so cozy! Wear them most of the day
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Love the fur all in the inside. Very warm and huge my feet.
review.name: Into these boots!

review.reviewBody: The sole is separating from the body. I now have wet cold feet!! Only owned for two seasons, worn lightly for 6 months. Only 1 year warranty!!
review.name: Easy on and off

review.reviewBody: I have tried so many brands over the years, and this is the first pair of winter boots that have the grip I have been looking for. They arrived a week before the big winter storm we just had, and they have served me well. If traction is a deal breaker for you, then this are the boots you want
review.name: Real Traction

name: Arcata Tonal Camo Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Abrasive straps will destroy your clothes.  Not for use as a women's day bag or purse alternative.  Should only be worn over coats.
review.name: Beware of abrasive straps

review.reviewBody: Ok, here is the deal. I bought the ox red 15-inch laptop Kanken for travel. I love it. Then I bought the frost green classic Kanken for work and the peachy pink mini for an everyday purse. To say that I am obsessed is an understatement. I love all of the backpacks, and the mini is no exception. I carry bags based on mood. The peachy pink color is an adorable, fun color for any age. I am a 63-year-old baby boomer who still works and goes to school, so I stay busy loving life. I forgot to mention that I bought the assorted Fjallraven pouches to fill up my backpack. I have the old version of the pencil case, the gear pocket, and the gear bag to organize all my things. I do recommend all of their backpacks.
review.name: Mini Kanken (Peachy Pink)

review.reviewBody: I got gifted this from a friend for my birthday and I have had it for a while now. It is the best backpack that I have. I also have the bigger version of this and I love how comfortable they are to carry around. I love these backpacks so much.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody: I have wanted a kanken since I was 13, I'm now 20 and with adult money I decided to buy a kanken mini. Mainly for every day use like going shopping or for a walk. I am extremely disappointed. The straps in the pictures look so long but in reality they aren't! My boyfriend loosened them to loosest they would go for me and it was so high up my back and so uncomfortable. I'm so sad and disappointed that it didn't live up to expectations.  Will be returning.
review.name: Straps are way to short!!!!

review.reviewBody: Köpte denna ryggsäcken till min dotter och den passar lika bra som jag förväntade mig att den skulle. Stabil, praktisk, lagom stor för henne och perfekt för förskolan. När den blir för liten för henne tänker jag använda den själv, synd att det är lite korta band för en vuxen men eftersom det inte var mitt syfte med köpet så är jag mer än nöjd. Älskar kånken!
review.name: Perfekt barnryggsäck

review.reviewBody: Perfect everyday 'purse ' and will fit a rolled up raincoat in addition to my items.
review.name: Finally found my go to bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a Christmas gift for myself. I was SO excited as I know others that have this bag so I knew the quality. I absolutely LOVE the bag but HATE the straps. I’m 5’4” and wear an XL and feel like I’m wearing a 4 year olds backpack with how short the straps are and how high the bag sits on my back. I will be returning the bag unfortunately strictly due to the short straps. Bummer. Really love the sky blue color. Wish it just had a tad bit longer straps.
review.name: LOVE the backpack HATE the straps.

review.reviewBody: A great size. Sturdy construction. Comfy when worn.
review.name: Cute & functional

review.reviewBody: Guys don't be intimidated by this small bag.  You can carry one too.  I've needed a bag to carry a cache of things when I take my kids to the pool, or the zoo, or some other place.  I tried many fanny packs and sling bags and they all fell short.  So I picked up a Känken Mini at my local outfitter and I couldn't be happier.  It came with a butt pad for sitting and the strap system is so clever.  Get yourself one and be happy.
review.name: I'm 6'2" 280lbs and I love this little bag.

review.reviewBody: I have the kanken mini fog color. I just love it. It matches to most of my everyday outfits. Very spacious for its size. I could always bring my essentials wherever I go. Very convenient. Worth the price.
review.name: Spacious

name: Kanken Mini 7L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Fit great. Had to use Velcro waist adjuster to make a bit smaller to get best waist fit. Usually a 33 waist for pants. 5’10” 160. Got size large.
review.name: Fit great. Had to use

review.reviewBody: These pants are excellent in any and all conditions and stay dry. The fit is a classic straight leg if you want baggy then just size up. The color is great and can be worn with many other options
review.name: These pants are excellent in

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After wearing out my north face pants, I decided to spend a bit more with this purchase. The quality comparison between the two are night and day. 686 craftsmanship are on another level.
review.name: Quality beyond expected

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the color, they are very warm for a shell pant, and very comfortable too.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: Dry and wind resistant! Super nice for the pnw! Boa compatible gators are the nicest touch!

Good fit.
Seems to be pretty waterproof and the color looks nice.
review.name: Good pair of pants for snowboarding

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven’t had a chance to tip in these they but I was looking for a looser fit and these seems to be more fitted and tapered.
review.name: I haven’t had a chance

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit on these and super comfortable fabrics - not all crinkly and "swishy" Nylon, but just right. I'm 6'2 and 225lbs with a 33" inseam and these were the exact fit I was looking for. Not skin tight or pulling when I sat down and also not super blown out baggy like Dojos. Zippers and features and vents are also all really well thought out - I may buy a second pair in a different color, as I know I'm going to be riding these for a long time!
review.name: "Just Right" fit and materials - new favorite pair of riding pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super lite weight and easy for movement. Quality pants the seams are just right. More relaxed fit for extra layering if needed.
review.name: Styling and profiling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants were absolutely accurate and color and quality. I tried to wander an absolutely perfect fit the materials 10 times better than I thought it would be. I’ve always loved and appreciated 686. I’m so happy that I finally purchased some items directly from you guys and your website I look forward to really trying these pants out in the snow this coming January. Thank you so much happy holidays.
review.name: I love 686
