review.reviewBody:
Found N.EXT tube type tires highly unstable at high speed descents. Main issue is any slight cross wind introduced instability. Ran them between 55-90psi. The sweet spot was the lowest psi, but lacked speed and road feel. Never felt planted or connected to the road. 
Put on an old set of Vittoria Corsa CX and stability issue was gone. Speed and confidence went up, drama gone. 
I had these in 28 on 19mm internal carbon wheels, 45 deep on a gen4 SuperSix. 
Never had an issue like this with multiple tires I have ran over the years. Very weird. 
+ one star for ease of install and removal.
review.name: Not stable

review.reviewBody: Been using for years the Vittoria Corsa 2.0 with fabric sides, loved those since I switched, bike rolled and hugged the pavement better. Decided to switch it up to these and wow even more of an improvement! I also upped the width used and feels more stable on my rides also. Still a struggle to get the last bit of tire on the rim as with the others but maybe not as much might needed, overall extremely happy with these as my clincher tire of choice.
review.name: Great tires

review.reviewBody: Having come from Conti 5000 and Vittoria Rubino Pro, in my experience the Corsa Next are better performers overall. The most notable difference is the handling: it is firm and confident especially around fast turns.  They are also as fast on the straights as any other tire. The ride is a bit more comfortable as well, does a nicer job soaking up rough roads. No flats so far and the tread has only a few very minor cuts. With 1,500 miles on the Corsas the tread wear indicators on the rear tire are almost gone.  I usually get 3,000 miles out of my tires.  So, it seems that faster wear is one trade off with these tires. Still, I will be sticking with the Corsa Nexts when it’s time to replace. FYI, I run 30mm tires on all the tires mentioned and inflate to 65psi.
review.name: Excellent Overall

review.reviewBody:
After less than 1,000 miles, both front and back tires split, and the rear got a star shaped void. 
Installed 30mm paired with latex tube. Even putting them on tubeless wheels was not too bad. Pressure 80 lbs. 
It is too bad because the ride was comfortable, grip and cornering was terrific. Acceleration was snapper. 
Ride was great but don't recommend because durability is so poor.
review.name: Not Durable

review.reviewBody: I bought a set of these tires to replace an older generation Vittoria Corsa's with cotton sidewalls. I paired them with TPU inner tubes and find the ride quality to be just-as-good with better puncture resistance, of which was the result I was wanting. Note that they do require a bit of elbow grease to get onto your rims, even though these aren't tubeless.
review.name: Solid Road Tires

review.reviewBody: Purchased a pair of Vittoria Corsa Next clinchers size 26.  Only one ride, but the feel was really nice.  Much better feel and grip as compared with Conti 5000s.  Can’t say if they are faster or slower, but the road feel is super.  Conti 5000s are practically impossible to mount.  But I mounted the Corsa Next tires with my hands and no tools.  Conti 5000s aren’t worth he hassle and the Corsa Next have a better ride quality.
review.name: Better feel than Conti 5000

review.reviewBody: Call it superstition, but part of me is terrified to write this review, lest I should pick up a puncture on my next ride…but I am really enjoying the tires and think it is only fair to leave a positive review!  Prior to the Corsa N.EXT I had run two full seasons exclusively on Conti GP 5000 and wanted to give these a try for comparison’s sake.  Running a 28 mm on a Trek Madone SLR7 the Vittoria are definitely my preference over the Conti tires at this juncture.  Handling is very nice and confident, though it is worth noting that I generally do not ride outdoors much in the rain/wet.  When it has started to come down or I ride through damp patches the handling is still confident, though I back off quite a bit in those conditions.  Comfort is on par with or better than the Conti tires, and it is nearly impossible to tell if there is any difference to speed.  I’ll call the quality level as even, and durability appears to be on par or better at just under 1,000 miles of usage.  To be fair, I’ve also had a couple of unlucky incidents with the GP 5000s, so durability and longevity are still a TBD in my mind as a true comparator.  One major win for the N.EXT is ease of installation.  The Conti tires were always a bear to get on and off of my rims, but I was able to easily install the Vittoria tires without levers.
review.name: Great Tire

name: Corsa N.EXT G2.0 Clincher Tire

review.reviewBody:
I love this vest! It's very fitted which is perfect for me as an obstacle course racer. Even with holding something in the back pocket, I don't feel like I'm carry anything bulky on my back. 

I do wish the front pockets were closed/ separate from the side. I've had a few instances were a gel has fallen out of the side when I put it in a front pouch. Also, the elastic cord, particularly on the side, can cause some awkward rubbing/ chaffing.
review.name: Almost perfect

hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Pulse Cargo Box online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Cheap materials, only opens on one side and flimsy when attached to the roof (installed 100% correctly). I returned this and bought another brand.
review.name: Not the quality I'd expect from Thule

review.reviewBody: First box that I've purchased and it's done everything I need it to. Have used it for multiple long hauls and have been pleased with how much it fits. Especially good for soft luggage. It's also well made and smart looking.
review.name: Better than expected

review.reviewBody: Very poor taste in design to find out internal locks are made of plastic. I use this rooftop for a solid three years and this internal part wrecks the entire unit. It is now a paperweight because they do not sell spare parts
review.name: Pulse M
comment:
Thank you for alerting us to the issue you experienced with your Thule Pulse lock mechanism. 
Some components of Thule cargo carriers are not available as replacement parts because they are riveted into place. These cannot be removed and replaced without the high likelihood of further damage to the cargo carrier, so are only able to be installed at the time of manufacture. 
A representative has reached out for more information on the cause of the issue to see if there are any other ways we may be able to assist.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a couple Thule boxes over the years and they’re just great accessories for active, outdoorsy people. The low profile of my new Pulse Alpine was a big selling point for me, but was pleasantly surprised with a quick and easy attachment system. It looks great and will accommodate skis longer in length than what my friends and I ski. The summer time sees it filled with camping gear and other stuff like frisbees, tennis rackets, footballs, folding chairs, river tubes, etc. I loved my first one and I love my new one.
review.name: Always a quality product and experience

review.reviewBody: Great Thule, can fit 2 snowboards and pair of skis along with some smaller bags. Definitely be patient when installing it to the rails and requires more than 2 people. Overall so happy with it and excited to for our cross country trip!
review.name: Love my Thule!

review.reviewBody: This is the first roof top cargo box that I have owned. Installation was a breeze! we just finished a 1500 mile road trip and had zero issues. Also the “pod” holds much more than I had anticipated. I would highly recommend the company and their products!
review.name: Great Purchase!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this carrier for the upcoming snow season and we recently installed it for our summer vacation. It held more than I expected and worked great!
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: the thule was so easy to install. love the look. it is so sleek that it looks awesome on my car. thank you
review.name: sleek and sharp

review.reviewBody: Great product and super easy to install even without a Thule crossbar
review.name: Easy to install

review.reviewBody: We just traveled about 1300 miles with our thule. It was easy to install and pack. We had a little noise, but that's to be expected. It looks great too!
review.name: Looks, works great

name: Pulse Cargo Box

review.reviewBody: Very nice quality as I expected. Only complaint is it is a little small. Thought the 100 would have been too big. Need an 80, if it ever made!
review.name: 60 L duffel

review.reviewBody: Incredible bag, super tough. Lives up to the name of Yeti
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: I love it i use it everywhere i go definitely the best in the business
review.name: Best duffel bag

review.reviewBody: Construction and hardware just what one would expect from Yeti
review.name: Girlfriend’s New Gym Bag

review.reviewBody: Very nice duffle bag, durable and spacious great size
review.name: Definitely recommend

review.reviewBody: I bought mine for safari because it required soft aided luggage.  Excellent quality.  Functions like a suitcase with a full opening to access the storage compartments.  Very sturdy double zippers with overlapping holes to put the TSA lock on. At first it looked small put when you pack it full you discover that it will hold more than you think.  The foam bottom and sides hold it upright for easy packing and access.
review.name: Acts like a suitcase.

review.reviewBody: The inside of the bag is roomy and well-made. The shoulder strap isn't well padded and can be uncomfortable when carrying the bag when it is packed.
review.name: Roomey bag

review.reviewBody: Great bag! A lot more roomy than you think it will be. Combined with packing cubes, I managed to pack for a five night trip and still had room.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I ordered this based upon my experience with other Yeti products and how well they are made; very. I can say absolutely that this is made of the same quality. I love this duffle. My wife and I purchased two of the larger and smaller ones after buying this one for our travels. At this time, the Yeti bag is not as well known as the coolers so when we take a plane there are no other bags to confuse it with on the luggage belt. I'm sure this will be a short lived convenience.
review.name: Durable, no frills bag that's good on the eye.

review.reviewBody: Excellent travel bag. Well built and heavy duty, will definitely last for years to come.
review.name: Awesome bag

review.reviewBody:
Today I received my backpack 🎒 
My expectations were met. Very high quality, keeps its shape, looks great on the back. All my things fit, I plan to use it every day to go to work. Small pockets are enough to put all the important things.
review.name: Good buy and good choice

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a casual but cute dog mom backpack and this definitely fits the bill!
review.name: Simple and chic

review.reviewBody: Got this bag about 2 weeks ago and it really met my expectation. Thule is known for quality products and I wasnt disappointed once again. I wish it came in more color options but it’s all good. Thank you Thule!
review.name: The bag to get!

review.reviewBody: Looks very nice - stylish and light, which is what I wanted. A few things missing — wish there was a larger zip pocket inside to store valuables like phone and wallet. The front pocket has easy open flap for those items but it’s only held shut with a light magnet and if falling off a bike or something, those things will go flying. But for general use, seems to be ok. Just got it so no idea of longevity yet. Have a Thule Crossover that is a tank, still in perfect condition after 7 years so hoping this will be made as well. Like the light colored interior so you can find things.
review.name: Looks nice, very light

review.reviewBody: I’m really enjoying the Thule Lithos backpack since I bought it 2 weeks ago! The straps are comfortable and offer great support with a full load, the compartments make it easy to organize things (and not lose items to the bottom of a bag) and the side pouches have enough stretch to fit my Nalgene. The backpack is a little slim but I think it will stretch over time, I would recommend it for daily use but not for travel.
review.name: Beautiful sturdy backpack!

review.reviewBody:
I searched high and low for a simple black backpack that holds a 15 inch laptop. This bag fits it perfectly and still does not look awkward. It is classy and get extremely functional. It is not full of useless pockets. Holds my water bottle beautifully. I cannot say enough good things about it. 

ps Super comfortable …. I walk 30 mins to work and home everyday.
review.name: A great bag!!

review.reviewBody: Brilliant design fulfills all my needs and requirements.
review.name: Perfect elegant work backpack

review.reviewBody: After lots of research between patagonia, the north face, and nike/adidas backpacks, I finally bought the thule lithos 20L for college. And I feel like all my research paid off. This backpack is the perfect size for bringing all the supplies needed for class. The zippers are very smooth and feel high quality. The fabric holds its shape, so it gives the backpack lots of structure and a nice thickness. The waterbotle holders are roomy for my slim water bottle, but might not work for those huge hydro flask bottles. The front pocket snaps back into place very satisfyingly. And perhaps most importantly, it's so comfortable to wear!
review.name: Great Quality and Great Look

name: Lithos 20L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I love this coat! I live in Alberta, Canada and I am always cold (I keep my house at 22 C and also sit under a blanket). I have only had this coat a few weeks, but I LOVE it. As other reviewers have mentioned, it’s a bit like wearing a sleeping bag, but in a good way. I bought the navy blue, which is true to the picture online. I’ve already gotten compliments on the colour. I was so warm and cozy today at -25 C with only a light layer underneath. It is soft, wind resistant and light weight. I know it to continue to keep me warm below -25 temperatures. I ordered XS as per the size chart (the fit finder recommended size small). The XS fits perfectly with room for layers. I am 5’10 with long arms and find the sleeve length to be great and the coat falls just below my knees. I love all of the pockets, drawstrings and snaps. What a great investment!
review.name: I love this coat!

review.reviewBody: I recently moved back to Michigan after living in South Florida for 17 years.  I knew I would need a solid coat to be comfortable this winter.  This coat is a dream, literally like wearing a warm cloud. I love it. I got a size Large, to give me extra room to add even more layers - I am happy I did.  Medium would fit perfect but I like it being more roomy and comfortable.
review.name: Warmest Coat EVER!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this, but I send it back. I have the jacket, and love it. I was longing for the long one. The feeling was not the same, not the very full of down, not the feeling that it should be warm enough like the jacket😩

I bought this 3 weeks ago and it is amazing. If I could give 10 stars instead of 5 I would! I stay in a mountain area, and in this period the temperatures drop below -15 degrees Celsius! I walk the dog in the morning or evening sometimes only with a t-shirt under the jacket and I am perfectly warm. I totally recommend it!
review.name: Totally recommend it!

review.reviewBody: The warmest coat I have ever owned. I’ve been wearing it with one layer underneath and extremely warm. And it is so light! Great coat!
review.name: Warmest coat ever!

review.reviewBody: Looks like a great coat but unfortunately had to return because the coat was huge. Would recommend sizing down or trying on in store before purchasing.
review.name: Huge

review.reviewBody: Great jacket , warm and toasty ,  no more cold hikes
review.name: Best jacket

review.reviewBody: Purchased this coat for my artic holiday… it was perfect; warm, comfortable and gave the perfect amount of protection against artic winds. Highly recommended!
review.name: The ultimate artic coat

review.reviewBody: I got this coat for winter in chicago and it was 18 degrees outside yesterday. I went on a walk for two whole hours and didn’t feel cold once. This is THE winter coat. Don’t even hesitate at price because you’ll have this for years. fantastic construction, awesome bright blue color and i got the medium as a 165lb woman and have tons of room for  sweaters underneath (that i won’t need!!!!)
review.name: obsessed

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so warm and the material feels very soft. I love the longer length and have gotten many compliments when wearing this jacket. Roomy fit. Got a small and love that the sleeves are long. 5?8? 135 for reference. Highly recommend!
review.name: So warm!

name: Expedition Long Down Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody: Kuhl quality is not what it once. I have 10 year old Kuhl shirts where the plackets and pocket flaps still lay flat and collars hold their shape to this day. Without any ironing. This shirt looks like it has been through a war after one washing. Sure, I can iron it, but that's not what I was looking for in an "adventure" shirt. Oh - I normally wear between a L and XL in shirts, depending on brand. I had to go to XXL on this shirt (thanks for *that* ego boost Kuhl), and it is still small-ish and comically short. Yet the sleeves are too long. Odd proportions. I'm already in for one return shipping charge, so I'll keep it. But it was not the quality I expected. I had come to expect shirts from Kuhl that can go from trail to a casual night out and look great. This one is more like trail to bar fight. Hear me: it will *not* look like the shirt on the model after the first washing.
review.name: Hmmm.

name: Descendr Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: If you are looking for a bag with additional storage this isn’t it. The small pocket is just big enough for a grigri. You could get some shoes in the main compartment along with a 40m rope but it is tight.
review.name: Good for rope but that’s it

review.reviewBody:
I just got into climbing and I'm hooked, but I still don't know much, so I plan on top ropping with a group of friends for now. It fits my 70m 9.8 rope, harness, chalk bag, anchor setup with room to spare. Climbing shoes clipped on the outside. I could definitely fit a set of quickdraws once I upgrade to sports climbing. And maybe a light trad rack too.
I was worried what the bag would look like in person because all the reviews online showed the older model with different colored straps. I give it A+ looks with A+ simplicity, utility and durability. Would definitely recommend for a good no-nonsense rope bag.
review.name: Great rope bag!

name: Classic Rope Bag

review.reviewBody: My other brand shoe covers which I use when racing TTs were coming apart, but was hesitant to buy the same again. Came across these here and decided to give them a try. They seem to be more rugged than my first ones and are definitely taller. Like any cover that goes up the leg, they’re tough to put on, but since I now have a pair of dedicated shoes for racing I simply leave them on those shoes. They kind of rubbery and don’t seem to breathe so are a bit warmer. Am I any faster with these? Who knows, but they look the part 😉
review.name: Well made shoe covers for TTs

review.reviewBody: Have raced with these a number of times now in TTs.  They look good and feel fast, but how long they will is the question.  These things aren't cheap and take a lot of abuse putting on and taking off.  Also, I did have to size up one size from the suggested size.
review.name: Great Initially, but how durable?

name: -6 Fast Feet Booties

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit and durable for downhill. Recommend this for any MTB activities.

review.itemreviewed: Impact Pro Mid Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The soles of this shoe are much, much less sticky than the previous version. I had the same shoe before and liked them so much that I decided to buy another pair and these are just not as grippy. I guess this is the way of the world, charge more to customers and give them less quality.
review.name: not as sticky as previous model shoes

review.itemreviewed: Impact Pro Mid Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The best flat pedal shoe for stability, grip and safety. The D3O ankle pad is really nice for awkward moves and have def saved me from an ankle slap or seven. They are pretty warm in the winter with a nice thick wool sock and are plenty cool with a thin wool sock in the summer. They drain quick, don't become bricks when they do get wet and offer lots of protection without being too clunky. There isn't a better gripping shoe for mountain biking on the market. Ten out of ten.
review.name: The best flat pedal mountain bike shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Impact Pro Mid Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these shoes. Sticks to pedals like glue! Gives me more confidence as a rider.

review.itemreviewed: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody: I struggled with finding the right boots for the last decade. I would have heel lift with everything. These Boots are absolutely perfect and eliminate all heel lift with the boa str8jkt. And the lace allows for tightening and loosening in different spots, perfect
review.name: Finally zero heel lift! Perfect boots

review.itemreviewed: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody: These boots fit perfect and are comfortable all day long. They are more on the stiff side but still comfy. Definitely recommend these boots.
review.name: Super comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody:
Overall this is a really nice boot, I've tried many boots and these have a really premium feel and construction that feels like it will last a long time. The str8jacket is my favorite part, does an excellent job of locking your heel down especially compared to some of the other boa mechanisms on the market.

My only critique is that I do feel the boot is softer and more park oriented than its rated (more of a preference thing so not really worth losing a star). There is great board feel but very little dampening which feels like more of a park oriented trait. I dropped an aftermarket insole in and it defintely helped, but I still wish the tongue was a bit stiffer.

If you lean toward being in the park a bit more than elsewhere on the mountain these are the best choice out there!
review.name: Softer than rated but overall a great boot

review.itemreviewed: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody: Ridden in these for 60+ days this year and they've held up really well. I love the STR8JKT pro, it holds your heel down better than any other boot I've used. These boots are also very slim, it almost feels like I'm wearing a tennis shoe with these on, it really allows me to carve deeper and tweak grabs better as opposed to a chunky boot.
review.name: Great boot

review.itemreviewed: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody: Wore them from dusk till dawn, snowboarding on the Laurentians.  Was stable, comfortable, and warm all day.  Just took a few runs to find the right amount of tightening.
review.name: Solid, comfortable, warm

review.itemreviewed: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody: I like the features on this boot. Comfortable liner with lots of toe space. Boot itself seems very durable and the flex is stiff, as described, but broke in nicely throughout the first day.
review.name: Quality boot

review.itemreviewed: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody: Before the Dialogues, I had the Launchs- both great boots. Use them for everything, from riding in the park to touring the backcountry. Very comfortable and durable. This is my 7th season on Salomon boots. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great all around boot

name: Dialogue Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: Love this sandal!!  So comfortable and looks great with a variety of clothing styles!  I have it in three different colors.
review.name: My go-to sandals!

review.reviewBody: I just love my orange Sorel Dayspring sandals soo much! I love the name, the look, the fit, the feel, the absolutely everything about them! They are amazingly comfortable and supportive in every way -- they support my feet, of course, and that in turn means they also support my whole body, and in addition to that, they support my self-image! They are progressive, fun, strong, smooth, cool, and neato-keen! They're great indoors and outdoors on all types of surfaces including slick-with-rain ones .... I'm so happy I found these! I'm so glad I bought them! I'm so grateful they come in orange! I also love that they remind me of teaching canoeing in the Boundary Waters Area, close to Canada -- where I first discovered Sorels .... I'm actually amazed at how all-around wonderful they are, having had no idea Sorel made anything but boots until I found these -- and what a find they are! I got rid of my old sandals after wearing these for a while and they have been excellently cheerful companions for me all summer long .... Highly recommended! But, only if this is your kind of thing! For me, they are certainly most perfect!
review.name: Best Sandals Ever! :-D

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable sandals ever! I’m small so the added height is a plus!
review.name: So cute and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: So cute and really well made!! I bought the orange and the color is gorgeous. They’re very comfortable, too. I got my normal size and they fit perfectly. Love them!
review.name: Love these!

name: Dayspring Slide Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: I cannot say enough good things about this bag, I've used it for almost two years now. The adjustable shoulder straps make it a great fit for just about everyone, the chest strap is also adjustable, the hip straps are set which makes sense since everything else is adjustable. The back access is so nice for essentials, I usually keep what I need quick access to right there, sunscreen, googles, etc. Plenty of room for everything. The side pocket is a great incognito spot for your wallet and keys, I keep wet skins in the storage dry bag inside. I've taken it on so many trips as a carry on with my skateboard on the bag. It really is a great all-around bag. Love it!
review.name: I use it for just about everything

name: Snow Pro 32L Backpack
